creditline: Gift of Anne-Lise and David Whitescarver
description: abstracted image with various geometrical forms; green rectilinear form at right; red vertical rectangle near center; grey elements at left with white O and H forms, red and black horizontal elements in ULQ; yellow horizontal sloping line in LLQ; blue ground; received in black and silver shadow box frame without glazing
signed: LLC in pale green/yellow:  J S
text: Joe Solman was an influential modernist painter based in New York. He was politically active and outspoken on artistic freedom. Among his closest friends were artists who went completely abstract -- Adolph Gottlieb and Mark Rothko -- but Solman was never satisfied with that route. As is evident in his paintings, he preferred to push representation to the edge, putting design and form together to enphasize the modernist grid, but always referred to the observable world.
title: Harbor
